The Pokémon this card is attached to can use the attack on this card. (You still need the necessary Energy to use this attack.) If this card is attached to 1 of your Pokémon, discard it at the end of your turn. Colorless → Devolution
Devolve each of your opponent’s evolved Pokémon by putting the highest Stage Evolution card on it into your opponent’s hand.

rules: · Pokémon Tool rule: You may attach any number of Pokémon Tools to your Pokémon during your turn. You may attach only 1 Pokémon Tool to each Pokémon, and it stays attached.
name: Technical Machine: Evolution

abilities.name: Effect
abilities.text:
The Pokémon this card is attached to can use the attack on this card. (You still need the necessary Energy to use this attack.) If this card is attached to 1 of your Pokémon, discard it at the end of your turn. Colorless → Evolution
Choose up to 2 of your Benched Pokémon. For each of those Pokémon, search your deck for a card that evolves from that Pokémon and put it onto that Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

rules: · Pokémon Tool rule: You may attach any number of Pokémon Tools to your Pokémon during your turn. You may attach only 1 Pokémon Tool to each Pokémon, and it stays attached.
name: Technical Machine: Turbo Energize

abilities.name: Effect
abilities.text:
The Pokémon this card is attached to can use the attack on this card. (You still need the necessary Energy to use this attack.) If this card is attached to 1 of your Pokémon, discard it at the end of your turn. Colorless → Turbo Energize
Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Energy cards and attach them to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

rules: · Item rule: You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.
name: Techno Radar

abilities.name: Effect
abilities.text: You can use this card only if you discard another card from your hand. Search your deck for up to 2 Future Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

rules: · Supporter rule: You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.
name: Tulip

abilities.name: Effect
abilities.text: Put up to 4 in any combination of Psychic Pokémon and Basic Psychic Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.

abilities.name: Effect
abilities.text: As long as this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides Colorless Energy. When you attach this card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon, heal 30 damage from that Pokémon.

name: Crustle
flavorText: Its thick claws are its greatest weapons. They’re mighty enough to crack Rhyperior’s carapace.

attack.name: Crag Bash
attack.text: During your opponent’s next turn, this Pokémon takes 100 less damage from attacks from Evolution Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Dottler
flavorText: As it grows inside its shell, it uses its psychic abilities to monitor the outside world and prepare for evolution.

attack.name: Protect
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent’s next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.

name: Toedscruel

abilities.name: Slime Mold Colony
abilities.text: Cards in your opponent’s discard pile can’t be put into their hand by an effect of your opponent’s Abilities or Trainer cards.

flavorText: It coils its 10 tentacles around prey and sucks out their nutrients, causing the prey pain. The folds along the rim of its head are a popular delicacy.

attack.name: Mushroom Drain
attack.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

name: Magby
flavorText: This Pokémon makes its home near volcanoes. At the end of the day, Magby soaks in magma, resting and recovering from the day’s fatigue.

attack.name: Scorching Heater
attack.text: During your opponent’s next turn, if this Pokémon is damaged by an attack (even if it is Knocked Out), put 6 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

name: Iron Moth

abilities.name: Thermal Reactor
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when this Pokémon moves from your Bench to the Active Spot, you may move any amount of {R} Energy from your other Pokémon to it.

flavorText: No records exist of this species being caught. Data is lacking, but the Pokémon’s traits match up with an object described in an old book.

attack.text: Once during your turn, when this Pokémon moves from your Bench to the Active Spot, you may move any amount of Fire Energy from your other Pokémon to it.

attack.name: Heat Ray
attack.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can’t use Heat Ray.

name: Snorunt
flavorText: It is said that several Snorunt gather under giant leaves and live together in harmony.

attack.name: Ice Shard
attack.text: If your opponent’s Active Pokémon is a Fighting Pokémon, this attack does 30 more damage.

name: Mantyke
flavorText: It swims along with a school of Remoraid, and they’ll all fight together to repel attackers.

attack.name: Buoyant Healing
attack.text: Heal 120 damage from 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Vanillish
flavorText: It blasts enemies with cold air reaching −148 degrees Fahrenheit, freezing them solid. But it spares their lives afterward—it’s a kind Pokémon.

name: Wimpod
flavorText: Wimpod gather in swarms, constantly on the lookout for danger. They scatter the moment they detect an enemy’s presence.

attack.name: Sneaky Snacking
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard a random card from your opponent’s hand.

name: Veluza

abilities.name: Fillet Memento
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent’s Pokémon, move up to 2 {W} Energy cards from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

flavorText: When Veluza discards unnecessary flesh, its mind becomes honed and its psychic power increases. The spare flesh has a mild but delicious flavor.

attack.text: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent’s Pokémon, move up to 2 Water Energy cards from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attack.name: Hydro Pump
attack.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

name: Plusle
flavorText: It absorbs electricity from telephone poles. It shorts out its body to create crackling noises.

attack.name: Plus Damage
attack.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on your opponent’s Active Pokémon.

name: Minun

abilities.name: Buddy Pulse
abilities.text: If you have Plusle in play, whenever your opponent attaches an Energy card from their hand to 1 of their Pokémon, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon. The effect of Buddy Pulse doesn’t stack.

flavorText: It cheers on friends. If its friends are losing, its body lets off more and more sparks.

name: Blitzle
flavorText: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use the frequency and rhythm of these flashes to communicate.

attack.name: Wild Charge
attack.text: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

name: Joltik
flavorText: Joltik latch on to other Pokémon and suck out static electricity. They’re often found sticking to Yamper’s hindquarters.

attack.name: Flail Around
attack.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

name: Espathra

abilities.name: Stance
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may prevent all damage from and effects of attacks from your opponent’s Pokémon done to this Pokémon until the end of your opponent’s next turn.

flavorText: It emits psychic power from the gaps between its multicolored frills and sprints at speeds greater than 120 mph.

attack.name: Glittering Eyes
attack.text: If Tulip is in your discard pile, this attack does 70 more damage.

name: Gimmighoul
flavorText: This Pokémon was born inside a treasure chest about 1,500 years ago. It sucks the life-force out of scoundrels who try to steal the treasure.

attack.name: Continuous Coin Toss
attack.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

name: Groudon
flavorText: This legendary Pokémon is said to represent the land. It went to sleep after dueling Kyogre.

attack.name: Swelling Power
attack.text: Attach a Basic Fighting Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

attack.name: Magma Purge
attack.text: Discard up to 4 Energy from your Pokémon. This attack does 60 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

name: Mienshao
flavorText: Delivered at blinding speeds, kicks from this Pokémon can shatter massive boulders into tiny pieces.

attack.name: Three-Step Strike
attack.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

attack.name: Whip Expert
attack.text: If you attached a Pokémon Tool card from your hand to this Pokémon during this turn, this attack does 70 more damage.

name: Minior

abilities.name: Far-Flying Meteor
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is on your Bench, when you attach an Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon, you may switch it with your Active Pokémon.

flavorText: This is its form when its shell has fallen off. The color of its core depends on the materials that made up the food it ate.

attack.name: Gravitational Tackle
attack.text: This attack does 20 damage for each Colorless in your opponent’s Active Pokémon’s Retreat Cost.

name: Garganacl

abilities.name: Energizing Rock Salt
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may attach a Basic {F} Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon. If you attached Energy to a Pokémon in this way, heal 30 damage from that Pokémon.

flavorText: Garganacl will rub its fingertips together and sprinkle injured Pokémon with salt. Even severe wounds will promptly heal afterward.

attack.text: Once during your turn, you may attach a Basic Fighting Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon. If you attached Energy to a Pokémon in this way, heal 30 damage from that Pokémon.

name: Slither Wing
flavorText: This mysterious Pokémon has some similarities to a creature that an old book introduced as Slither Wing.

attack.name: Stomp Off
attack.text: Discard the top card of your opponent’s deck.

attack.name: Burning Turbulence
attack.text: This Pokémon also does 90 damage to itself. Your opponent’s Active Pokémon is now Burned.

name: Garbodor
flavorText: The toxic liquid it launches from its right arm is so virulent that it can kill a weakened creature instantly.

attack.name: Chuck
attack.text: Discard any number of Pokémon Tool cards from your hand. This attack does 50 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

attack.name: Venomous Hit
attack.text: Your opponent’s Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Yveltal
flavorText: When its life comes to an end, it absorbs the life energy of every living thing and turns into a cocoon once more.

attack.name: Cross-Cut
attack.text: If your opponent’s Active Pokémon is an Evolution Pokémon, this attack does 60 more damage.

attack.name: Dark Edge
attack.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Morpeko

abilities.name: In a Hungry Hurry
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has no Energy attached, it has no Retreat Cost.

flavorText: Hunger hormones affect its temperament. Until its hunger is appeased, it gets up to all manner of evil deeds.

attack.name: Energizer Wheel
attack.text: Move 2 Darkness Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Brute Bonnet

abilities.name: Toxic Powder
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon has an Ancient Booster Energy Capsule attached, you may make both Active Pokémon Poisoned.

flavorText: It is possible that the creature listed as Brute Bonnet in a certain book could actually be this Pokémon.

attack.name: Rampaging Hammer
attack.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can’t attack.

name: Steelix
flavorText: It is thought its body transformed as a result of iron accumulating internally from swallowing soil.

attack.name: Earthquake
attack.text: This attack also does 30 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don’t apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Ferrothorn

abilities.name: Exoskeleton
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: Its spikes are harder than steel. This Pokémon crawls across rock walls by stabbing the spikes on its feelers into the stone.

attack.name: Spinning Needles
attack.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon’s Spinning Needles attack does 100 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Aegislash

abilities.name: Mysterious Shield
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent’s Pokémon ex and Pokémon V.

flavorText: Its potent spectral powers allow it to manipulate others. It once used its powers to force people and Pokémon to build a kingdom to its liking.

attack.name: Hard Bashing
attack.text: This attack’s damage isn’t affected by any effects on your opponent’s Active Pokémon.

name: Aipom
flavorText: It searches for prey from the tops of trees. When it spots its favorite food, Bounsweet, Aipom gets excited and pounces.

attack.name: Filch
attack.text: Draw a card.

name: Loudred
flavorText: The force of this Pokémon’s loud voice isn’t just the sound—it’s also the wave of air pressure that blows opponents away and damages them.

attack.name: Body Slam
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent’s Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Swablu
flavorText: It can’t relax if it or its surroundings are not clean. It wipes off dirt with its wings.

attack.name: Bind Wound
attack.text: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

name: Porygon-Z

abilities.name: Buggy Turbo
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may flip a coin. If heads, attach up to 4 Basic Energy cards from your discard pile to this Pokémon. If tails, discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

flavorText: Some say an additional program made this Pokémon evolve, but even academics can’t agree on whether Porygon-Z is really an evolution.

attack.name: Energized Attack
attack.text: This attack does 40 damage for each Energy attached to this Pokémon.

name: Cyclizar
flavorText: Apparently Cyclizar has been allowing people to ride on its back since ancient times. Depictions of this have been found in 10,000-year-old murals.

attack.name: Driving Buddy
attack.text: If you played a Supporter card from your hand during this turn, this attack does 70 more damage.

name: Iron Jugulis
flavorText: It’s possible that Iron Jugulis, an object described in an old book, may actually be this Pokémon.

attack.name: Homing Headbutt
attack.text: This attack does 50 damage to 3 of your opponent’s Pokémon that have any damage counters on them. (Don’t apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attack.name: Baryon Beam
attack.text: If this Pokémon has a Future Booster Energy Capsule attached, this attack can be used for ColorlessColorlessColorless.

abilities.text: Look at the top 4 cards of your deck and put 2 of them into your hand. Shuffle the other cards and put them on the bottom of your deck.

rules: · Supporter rule: You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.
name: Tulip

abilities.name: Effect
abilities.text: Put up to 4 in any combination of Psychic Pokémon and Basic Psychic Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.

rules: · Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
· Tera Pokémon ex rule: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent’s).

rules: · Stadium rule: You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can’t be played.
name: Beach Court

abilities.name: Effect
abilities.text: The Retreat Cost of each Basic Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent’s) is Colorless less.

rules: · Item rule: You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.
name: Counter Catcher

abilities.name: Effect
abilities.text: You can use this card only if you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent. Switch in 1 of your opponent’s Benched Pokémon to the Active Spot.

rules: · Pokémon Tool rule: You may attach any number of Pokémon Tools to your Pokémon during your turn. You may attach only 1 Pokémon Tool to each Pokémon, and it stays attached.
name: Luxurious Cape

abilities.name: Effect
abilities.text: If the Pokémon this card is attached to doesn’t have a Rule Box, it gets +100 HP, and if it is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent’s Pokémon, that player takes 1 more Prize card. (Pokémon ex, Pokémon V, etc. have Rule Boxes.)

abilities.name: Effect
abilities.text: As long as this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides Colorless Energy. If you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent, and if this card is attached to an Evolution Pokémon that doesn’t have a Rule Box (Pokémon ex, Pokémon V, etc. have Rule Boxes), this card provides every type of Energy but provides only 3 Energy at a time.
